unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Discrete Probability Distributions: Assessing Validity
question_text: To check if her statistics students understood certain characteristics of discrete probability distributions, Mrs.  Jackson asked her students to do the following: Create a probability distribution for a discrete random variable where the sample space consists of $5$ distinct outcomes. The choices below show some of the probability distributions that Mrs. Jackson received. Which of the probability distributions is valid and meets Mrs. Jackson's criteria?
